required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High Flow Nasal Cannula for Safe Apnea
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of High-flow Nasal Oxygenation on Safe Apnea Time in Children With Open Mouth

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective randomized controlled trial comparing high flow nasal cannula and buccal oxygenation as method of oxygenation during apnea in children.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective randomized controlled trial comparing two oxygenation methods for prolongation of apnea time in children aged 0 to 10 years old.
This study measures time for the pulse oximetry drop from 100% to 92% after oxygenation with 100% oxygen, applying high flow nasal cannula or buccal oxygen insufflation via an oral Ring-Adair-Elwyn endotracheal tube connected to oxygen.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of apnea to drop of pulse oximetry to 92%, up to 520 seconds
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients that succeed in prolongation of apnea time while maintaining pulse oximetry > 92%

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of apnea to drop of pulse oximetry to 92%, up to 520 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: Time elapsed from start of apnea to resume of bag-mask ventilation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After resuming of bag-mask ventilation, up to 30 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: End-tidal carbon dioxide partial pressure of first resumed breath after apnea

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After resuming of bag-mask ventilation, up to 60 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: Lowest value of pulse oximetry after resume of bag-mask ventilation

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to pulse oximetry of 100 percent
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After resuming of bag-mask ventilation, up to 300 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: Time elapsed from resume of bag-mask ventilation to regain of 100 percent in the pulse oximetry value

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study to end of study, up to 20 min
secondary_outcome.description: Appearance of any arrhythmia or prolonged QT interval measured throughout the study

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study to end of study, up to 20 min
secondary_outcome.description: Mean non-invasive blood pressure measured throughout the study

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study to end of study, up to 20 min
secondary_outcome.description: Pulse oximetry measured throughout the study

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study to end of study, up to 20 min
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen reserve index measured throughout the study

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study to end of study, up to 20 min
secondary_outcome.description: Transcutaneous carbon dioxide level measured throughout the study

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of study to end of study, up to 20 min
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate measured throughout the study

arm_group.description: Application of high flow nasal cannula during apnea
Application of buccal oxygenation during apnea

intervention.description: Oxygen supplement via high flow nasal cannula at a rate of 2 liters/kg/min
Oxygen supplement intra-orally via oral Ring-Adair-Elwyn endotracheal tube connected to oxygen at a rate of 0.5 liters/kg/min

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children under 11 years old undergoing general anesthesia with American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status 1 or 2.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of enrollment from one or more legal guardians of the patient
- Plan of usage of supraglottic airway device as airway maintenance device
- Presence of upper respiratory tract infection of lung disease
- Premature infants younger than postconceptual age of 40 weeks
- Anticipation of difficult bag-mask ventilation due to facial anomaly or micrognathia
- Other conditions that are considered inappropriate for the study
